Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2014 03:53PM Olive71 wrote: Got the results from an ultrasound.  I am so scared.  Does anyone have any thoughts on these findings? Here is the report from the ultrasound: Hypoechoic area at the axillary tail in the left breast. Small hypoechoic nodular apprearing area with shadowing suggested at axillary tail. (.51 x .47 x .53 centimeters) No demonstration of cyst, ductal dilation, or vascular abnormality identified. B-rad category 0 = incomplete.  I am just so scared and don't have my diagnostic until Monday.

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2014 05:49PM Olive71 wrote: Thank you so much, Sarahjane.  I knew about the lump in my left breast (I can feel it), but had no idea something was in the right (i can't feel it).  Which is odd because the nurse said the left mass is .6 centimeters and the right one is 1.5 centimeters, so I can feel the smaller one but not the larger one.  I'm happy to hear you are doing well.  That gives me hope.  My mind is quick to go to the worst-case scenario.  I appreciate you responding so much.  Ty, ty, ty Olive

Posts.Content: Olive71 wrote: Hi.  I have a lump on my upper left breast.  About a month ago, the doc said it was cystic (by feeling it) asked me to wait until my next cycle completed to see if it was still there.  It was.  Had an ultrasound and they said it is a nodule at the end of the axillary tail?  It is hard, pea-sized, moveable between my fingers.  Ultrasound tech said he didn't see any bloodflow to it.  They are recommending a diagnostic mammo now, but my question is, can I just ask for a biopsy straight away?  This waiting is really hard and I have panic disorder.  Log in to post a reply
